Pre-Game Insights: India have an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match T20I series over Sri Lanka.
In the third T20I, India will have the option to test out their bench, while Sri Lanka will be looking to end the series on a high.
Toss Prediction: Suryakumar Yadav, the Indian captain, has a better chance of calling the toss right in comparison to Charith Asalanka, the captain of Sri Lanka.
Win Possibility: The likes of Yashasvi Jaiswal, Suryakumar Yadav, Rishabh Pant, and Hardik Pandya have scored the bulk of the runs for India at a high tempo in the first two T20Is.

For Sri Lanka, the opening pair of Pathum Nissanka and Kusal Mendis have provided fantastic starts at the top of the order in the first two T20Is, but the rest of the batting lineup has failed to capitalise on it.
Predicted powerplay score and first inni: The pitches at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium in Pallekele have been very good for batting in the first two T20I matches of the series, allowing the batters to score runs at a quicker pace.
With that, any total under 170 will be tough to defend in the second innings for either Sri Lanka or India.
Notably, the average first innings score is 170 at this venue in T20Is, while the first innings score in the upcoming match could range between 175-185.
The powerplay score could go up to 50-55.
